numbered_ace_sentences: 1. Other people have already pointed out a generational divide between youths and adults.
2. There seems to be a generational divide between youths and adults.
3. The survey included 21 countries.
4. In 12 of the 21 surveyed countries, more than 50 percent of youths had optimistic views.
5. These youths were between 15 years and 24 years old.
6. Adults reported positive attitudes towards the future in only 6 countries.
7. Older generations generally have a more negative mindset.
8. Younger generations envision brighter futures.
9. I ask why older generations have a more negative mindset.
10. I ask what factors contribute to the perception of the populace about whether the world is becoming a better place.
11. Bie B. Sea is a person.
12. Bie B. Sea is from Taihu Lake.
13. Bie B. Sea cited significant economic growth in Indonesia.
14. Bie B. Sea cited this economic growth to account for overall positivity in Indonesia.
15. Nicky is a person.
16. Nicky is from Wuxi.
17. Wuxi is in China.
18. Nicky conjectured that societal pressures lead to negative outlooks.
19. The stresses of the education system are an example of societal pressures.
20. I believe that this information is relevant to my community.
21. I speculate that growth mindsets are fundamental to progress.
22. Positivity is an essential part of a healthy society.
23. Positivity helps to motivate the populace of a society.
24. Positivity helps to inspire the populace of a society.
25. Positivity helps to encourage the populace of a society.
26. I hope that my community will work towards improving the world for future generations.
27. I hope that my country will work towards improving the world for future generations.
28. This hope is independent of the view of the future of these generations.
29. The title of this graph is "Age and Attitude: How Different Generations Perceive the Future".
